Html:
I don’t want to look myself out!!!

I can see all the benefit of a composite framework but I have a hard time getting started.

I have falling in the love with the Divelements Silverlight controls - se a demo here http://www.divelements.co.uk/silverlight/. The controls give me a nice Ribbon and a docking framework that makes me create docking, floating and dialogs windows.

The question is, can this kind of UI work with Prism and if not, Can someone help me with guidance on how to set up the infrastructure of a Silverlight application.

Right now I could need some help with setting up the menu clicks. I have read that you can use command to do that, but I don’t know where to start.

Please don’t give up on me :-) Me and my team is moving from MS Access with an SQL Server as the back-end to C#, NHibernate, Silverlight, Composite applications and Ioc – Yes my brain is about to exploded but it’s FUN to go to work now.

You can do some regionAdapter with the custom control.Our wpf application also use the businewss control.
Do't worry about it.
